718837f-a.folder: Chrystie Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

718838f-a.folder: Chrystie Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY
718838f-a.text:
Chrystie Street, west side, south from but not including Rivington Street, to but not including Delancey Street. The view also shows Rivington Street, west from Forsyth Street, to the Bowery. The clearance in the foreground is the site for the Roosevelt Park.
July 23, 1930
F. L. Sperr.
No Reproductions

718839f-a.folder: Chrystie Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY
718839f-a.text:
(1)
Chrystie Street, west side, north from and including Rivington Street. View shows the Mills House No. 2 at the N.W. corner of
Rivington and Chrystie Streets.
February 14, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date from a different angle, north from but not including Delancey Street. In the foreground is the
clearance for Roosevelt Park.
January 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

722974f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Chrystie Street, Manhattan, NY
722974f-a.text:
Rivington Street, east of Chrystie Street, showing in the background a
station of the Second Ave. Elevated Line. The demolition in the foreground, 1  is for the new Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sserr.

731755f-a.folder: Chrystie Street and Rivington Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
731755f-a.text:
Fire in house to be demolished, at Chrystie near Rivington Streets,
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
731755f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in a building.]

731756f-a.folder: Chrystie Street and Rivington Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
731756f-a.text:
Condemned property at corner of Chrystie and Rivington Streets, being
destroyed by firemen.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
731756f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in a building.]
